result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Bemus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Statutory costs assessed. FTP-54 consecutive days RCJ

Huber is granted for employment, treatment and child visitation.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if he has not already done so, within 30 days of release from confinement, and pay the DNA surcharge. Defendant may serve in Waukesha County but NOT on any kind of electronic monitoring. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: 15CF338

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
